conbody.p: Forecasting is is extrapolation of time series, to predict future values. This is done by using different statistical techniques. In order to be able to make an accurate prediction, it is important to discover a pattern in the historical data. This is done by analysis of the time series.
Excel has several options to make predictions.

ul.li: Through the equation of the trend line. The coefficients of the equation can be calculated with worksheet functions.

Through special worksheet functions
Linear model: FORECAST.LINEAR and TREND
Exponential model: GROWTH

Through new functions in Excel 2016. These functions use advanced features such as Exponential Triple Smoothing (ETS):
FORECAST.ETS)
FORECAST.ETS.SEASONALITY
FORECAST.LINEAR
FORECAST.ETS.CONFINT
FORECAST.ETS.STAT
Through the Add-in Data Analysis. This offers Exponential Smoothing and Moving Average. Furthermore you can also make correlation and regression calculations.
